meanings.definition: To give insufficient importance or emphasis to something.
meanings.sent1: She often underemphases the value of her own achievements.
meanings.sent2: He underemphases the impact of his words on others.
meanings.sent3: The comedian underemphases the seriousness of the situation for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her actions underemphases the gravity of the decision she made.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's underemphases on kindness left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: The act of downplaying or minimizing the significance of something.
meanings.sent1: His constant underemphases of his accomplishments make others overlook his talents.
meanings.sent2: The underemphases of the issue led to misunderstandings among the team members.
meanings.sent3: The underemphases of the storm's severity caused some to underestimate its impact.
meanings.sent4: The underemphases of the problem created a false sense of security.
meanings.sent5: The underemphases of the risks involved in the project proved to be a costly mistake.
